articles.headline: India Puts Wal-Mart Deal With Retailer Under Scrutiny
articles.snippet: Regulators are reviewing Wal-Mart’s investment of nearly $100 million in Bharti Retail at a time when India restricted investments in retailing.
articles.abstract: Regulators are reviewing Wal-Mart’s investment of nearly $100 million in Bharti Retail at a time when India restricted investments in retailing.
articles.lead_paragraph: MUMBAI — Indian regulators have begun an informal inquiry into allegations that Wal-Mart Stores violated rules restricting foreign investment in the country’s fast-growing retailing industry.

articles.headline: Shares Fall Sharply as Google Earnings Are Released Early
articles.snippet: Google’s quarterly results, released early by mistake, reflected losses at Motorola Mobility and plummeting prices for clicks on ads.
articles.abstract: Google’s quarterly results, released early by mistake, reflected losses at Motorola Mobility and plummeting prices for clicks on ads.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Google released a disappointing earnings report on Thursday that sent its stock price plummeting and reflected the challenges the company faces as it tries to make money in a mobile world.

articles.headline: U.S. Marriage Act Is Unfair to Gays, Court Panel Says
articles.snippet: A federal appeals court ruled that gay Americans are a class of people who deserve the same kinds of constitutional protections as many other victims of discrimination.
articles.abstract: A federal appeals court ruled that gay Americans are a class of people who deserve the same kinds of constitutional protections as many other victims of discrimination.
articles.lead_paragraph: A federal appeals court on Thursday ruled that gay Americans are a class of people who deserve the same kinds of constitutional protections as many other victims of discrimination.

articles.headline: A Computer Lesson Still Unlearned
articles.snippet: The Oct. 19, 1987, stock market crash was the beginning of the destruction of markets, as computers came in and human judgment went out.
articles.abstract: The Oct. 19, 1987, stock market crash was the beginning of the destruction of markets, as computers came in and human judgment went out.
articles.lead_paragraph: It was just a quarter-century ago that Wall Street was shaken to its core by the Oct. 19, 1987, stock market crash.

articles.headline: Suspect in Libya Attack, in Plain Sight, Scoffs at U.S.
articles.snippet: Days after President Obama vowed to apprehend those behind the Sept. 11 attack on American diplomats, a suspected ringleader spent an evening at a luxury hotel full of journalists.
articles.abstract: Days after President Obama vowed to apprehend those behind the Sept. 11 attack on American diplomats, a suspected ringleader spent an evening at a luxury hotel full of journalists.
articles.lead_paragraph: BENGHAZI, Libya — Witnesses and the authorities have called Ahmed Abu Khattala one of the ringleaders of the Sept. 11 attack on the American diplomatic mission here. But just days after President Obama reasserted his vow to bring those responsible to justice, Mr. Abu Khattala spent two leisurely hours on Thursday evening at a crowded luxury hotel, sipping a strawberry frappe on a patio and scoffing at the threats coming from the American and Libyan governments.

articles.headline: Airtime, a Pedigreed Start-Up, Is Tested
articles.snippet: Just four months after a much-hyped introduction, the video chat company has laid off employees and is tweaking its features.
articles.abstract: Just four months after a much-hyped introduction, the video chat company has laid off employees and is tweaking its features.
articles.lead_paragraph: It sounds like a recipe for success for a new start-up: Two famed entrepreneurs, tens of millions of dollars in the bank and endorsements from celebrities like Alicia Keys and Jim Carrey.

articles.headline: Campaigns See Latino Voters as Deciders in 3 Key States
articles.snippet: In Colorado, Florida and Nevada, ads and volunteers are being dispatched to make cases for President Obama and Mitt Romney.
articles.abstract: In Colorado, Florida and Nevada, ads and volunteers are being dispatched to make cases for President Obama and Mitt Romney.
articles.lead_paragraph: LAS VEGAS — Volunteers for President Obama have flooded into Latino-owned nail salons here, buttonholing potential Obama voters as they sit captive in their chairs. In Colorado, supporters of Mitt Romney are recruiting Latino owners of small businesses to reach out to other business owners whom they view as particularly receptive to the Republican economic message.
articles.byline: By Adam Nagourney and Fernanda Santos

articles.headline: Greg Smith’s Memoir Offers Few New Details on Goldman
articles.snippet: Greg Smith’s reminiscences of the pleasures of the job but does not seem to break much new ground on questionable practices at Goldman Sachs.
articles.abstract: Greg Smith’s reminiscences of the pleasures of the job but does not seem to break much new ground on questionable practices at Goldman Sachs.
articles.lead_paragraph: For several months, Goldman Sachs had been worried about what confidential details might come out in a memoir by Greg Smith, a former midlevel executive and trader who worked at the firm for a decade.

articles.headline: Shares Fall as Earnings Disappoint on Wall St.
articles.snippet: Investors were spooked on Friday by a growing number of pessimistic reports from corporate executives.
articles.abstract: Investors were spooked on Friday by a growing number of pessimistic reports from corporate executives.
articles.lead_paragraph: The growing list of downbeat financial announcements from American companies generated on Friday the worst stock sell-off in nearly four months.

articles.headline: Blast in Beirut Is Seen as an Extension of Syria’s War
articles.snippet: An explosion in a Christian section of Lebanon’s capital killed an official viewed by Syria as an enemy and was the most provocative violence in Lebanon tied to the Syrian conflict.
articles.abstract: An explosion in a Christian section of Lebanon’s capital killed an official viewed by Syria as an enemy and was the most provocative violence in Lebanon tied to the Syrian conflict.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — A powerful bomb devastated a Christian neighborhood of this capital city of Lebanon on Friday, killing an intelligence official long viewed as an enemy by neighboring Syria and unnerving a nation as Syria’s sectarian-fueled civil war spills beyond its borders and threatens to engulf the region.
